含义: The character '瓜' primarily means 'melon' or 'gourd'. It is used to refer to various types of melons and gourds, such as watermelon (西瓜), cucumber (黄瓜), and pumpkin (南瓜).
字形: The character '瓜' is a pictographic character that resembles the shape of a melon hanging from a vine. It consists of a central stroke representing the vine and a rounded shape below representing the melon.
读音: The pronunciation of '瓜' is 'guā' in Mandarin Chinese.
字源: The character '瓜' originated from ancient pictographs that depicted a melon hanging from a vine. Over time, the character evolved into its current form, retaining its visual connection to the melon.
同音字: 胍 (guā, a type of chemical compound)
成语: 瓜田李下 (guā tián lǐ xià, in a melon field or under a plum tree—avoiding suspicion)
瓜熟蒂落 (guā shú dì luò, when a melon is ripe, it falls off the stem—things will happen naturally when conditions are ripe)
滚瓜烂熟 (gǔn guā làn shú, to know something thoroughly)
例句: 夏天到了，我最喜欢吃西瓜。 (Xiàtiān dào le, wǒ zuì xǐhuān chī xīguā. Summer is here, and I love eating watermelon.)
他在瓜田里摘了一个大南瓜。 (Tā zài guātián lǐ zhāi le yīgè dà nánguā. He picked a big pumpkin in the melon field.)
短故事: Once upon a time, a farmer planted a melon seed in his field. He watered it every day and watched it grow. One day, a large watermelon appeared, and the farmer was so happy that he shared it with his entire village.

In ancient China, there was a saying that if you planted a melon, you would get a melon, and if you planted a bean, you would get a bean. This story emphasizes the importance of hard work and the natural consequences of one's actions.
诗词:
《西瓜》
绿皮红瓤甜如蜜，夏日清凉解暑气。 (Lǜ pí hóng ráng tián rú mì, xiàrì qīngliáng jiě shǔqì. Green skin, red flesh, sweet as honey, cooling and refreshing in the summer heat.)

《黄瓜》
青藤绿叶挂黄花，夏日凉拌最解暑。 (Qīng téng lǜ yè guà huáng huā, xiàrì liáng bàn zuì jiě shǔ. Green vines, green leaves, hanging yellow flowers, best served cold in the summer to beat the heat.)
